radiographic_examinations.findings: Known azygos continuation syndrome. Moderate enlargement of the right thyroid lobe. No supraclavicular, infraclavicular or axillary lymphadenopathy. No enlarged lymph nodes in the mediastinum or at the level of the hilar structures. Mild cardiomegaly. Several diverticular with contrast material. No osteolytic lesions at the level of the ribs, the sternum, or the vertebral bodies. Mild degenerative vertebral disease. No abnormalities in the lung parenchyma, except for some subpleural cysts. Non-suspicious 2 mm perifissural nodule in the middle lobe.
